snippet: Most of the 36 victims were young revelers who had come to ring in 2015 on the Bund, the city’s iconic riverfront promenade.
abstract: New Year's Eve stampede in Shanghai that has killed at least 36 people and injured 47 more is one of worst public tragedies to occur in China, country with history of fatal stampedes; stampede, made even more tragic by fact it occurred during celebration in Bund, historic showcase area, is reminder of how Chinese authorities must face challenge of managing country's mega-cities.
lead_paragraph: Most of the 36 victims were young revelers who had come to ring in 2015 on the Bund, the city’s iconic riverfront promenade.

headline.main: In Moments, New Year’s Revelry Became Fatal Crush in Shanghai
headline.print_headline: In Moments, New Year’s Revelry Became Fatal Crush in Shanghai
